title: no more color bar on container tabs since FF91
content:
FF91 64-bit Windows 10

I'm using 2 add-ons that use containers:

  1. Facebook container (Mozilla official)
  2. Temporary containers

Until recently open container tabs distinguished themselves from others by a colored bar under the name of the tab. Since the FF91 update this is gone.

Is there a setting to restore the color bar? Or an alternative?

More in general I find the new tab design since FF89 a step backward in ergonomics.

title: "Did Not Connect: Potential Security Issue" does not allow the user to continue even if they know what they are doing
content:
Hi,

There are circumstances where the domain owner of a given site could indeed have misconfigured their web site and I am grateful for Firefox detecting this and not immediately loading the page. My concern however is that I don't have the freedom to continue no matter what I try ("Advanced" only provides with the error message and has "Go back" option). I had to go so far to install Chrome in order to load the page - it detected the same problem but had a "go to the page despite this error" possibility. I am grateful for the security protection of Firefox but I would appreciate being allowed the freedom to load a page after being warned of any potential security hazard rather than being forced to not open it.

Thanks,
creator: plamen1

title: Bookmarks added that I Firefox put there
content:
Why is the system ADDING bookmarks to my list? Every day I delete them and every day Firefox bookmarks return to my list. Among others they include repeats over and over of items like "get involved", "Help and Tutorials", "About Us (from Firefox)" and others. I didn't put them there. I never went to these pages. Why do they keep showing up and why can't they simple be deleted and stay deleted? They slow down any attempt I make to find an actual bookmark that I place there.

Wading through all this information for support is ridiculous. There is no one place to get an answer. I've tried to report this as a bug and I've tried searching help files. I don't have time to read all this garbage. I just want this to work the way it used to work.

Nach dem update auf Firefox 91 ist der Abstand zwischen den Lesezeichen wieder vergrößert, obwoh ich alle Einstellungmit Proton in der config deaktiviert habe.

Gibt es eine Möglichkeit, die auch für "nichtprogrammierer" umzusetzen ist, den "alten Zustand" wieder herzustellen oder zwingt uns Mozilla nach jahrerlanger zufriedenheit einen neuen Browser zu suchen?

creator: sammy009

title: Add-Ons: country of origin???
content:
Dear community,

How can i see the "country of origin" of an add-on? I am highly sceptical of tools coming from countries like China, Russia, Belarus, North Korea, Hungary, Syria, Saudi-Arabia, Iran and all the other antidemocratic and / or authorian contries.

Example: "ant video downloader" seems to come from China but the link to their "ant.com.ltd." site does not work (not in Firefox nor in Chrome) and there is NO company info on "ant.com" or the add-on info page.

I would highly appreciate if someone from the Mozilla company could implement something like a "country of origin flag" so that every user can easily recognize in which country the specific add-on was programmed and is installed as integrated tool to the individual electronic device.

An "origin flag" could help to make things clear for every end-user :-D.

Best regards, Dirk.

title: 2021, nearly 2022, and browsers *still don't support* uploading a few thousand pictures in a few hundred sub-folders! :(
content:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/68736550/2021-nearly-2022-and-browsers-still-dont-support-uploading-a-few-thousand-p

2021, nearly 2022, and browsers *still don't support* uploading a few thousand pictures in a few hundred sub-folders! :(

i met a major disappointment this week, when i found out the one PHP + HTML5 solution for uploading more than a few thousand HD and 4K pictures to a Content Management System (plupload.com tied into my own https://github.com/nicerapp/nicerapp), just doesn't work yet. in 2021.

it is one thing that we, CMS builders i mean, needed to find a component like plupload.com which allows us to upload our pictures in 1MB chunks, then recombine them on the server, and make the thumbnail after that, but to not provide us with any means at all to get the relativePath of the files being uploaded, IS AN UTTER DISGRACE, if you ask me.

the CMS building community has been complaining about this to browser makers since at least 2014(!).

see https://www.plupload.com/punbb/viewtopic.php?id=4188 for details.

see https://github.com/nicerapp/nicerapp/blob/f6998dd03015fe8e0768b346ea7147dec314e6ab/nicerapp/userInterface/photoAlbum/4.0.0/jquery_ui_widget.3.1.3.php#L114 and https://github.com/nicerapp/nicerapp/blob/f6998dd03015fe8e0768b346ea7147dec314e6ab/nicerapp/userInterface/photoAlbum/4.0.0/jquery_ui_widget.3.1.3.php#L145 for a pinpointing of the problem..

and it's now 2/3 of the way through 2021 on the way to 2022(!!)... :(

we, the builders of apps and systems that run in the browser, need a solution for this big problem as soon as possible.

how hard can it be to properly support in document.getElementById('uploader').addEventListener('drop',function(event){...}) the functions event.dataTransfer.items[i].webkitGetAsEntry().createReader() and event.dataTransfer.items[i].webkitGetAsEntry().readEntries()?

IT IS PROBABLY EASY TO FIX, WHEN GIVEN PROPER ATTENTION AND PRIORITY!

2021/08/11 : So, i don't know if this is a plupload error or a Chrome error, the problem occurs on both Kubuntu->Chrome *and* Windows10->Chrome (for uploads of a few thousand pictures in a few hundred sub-folders), but it's up to the browser makers and the makers of plupload to fix it, as CMS builders simply do not have the means to produce a fix, let alone distribute that fix.

And one more thing : it is another disgrace that non-webkit browsers don't support the relativePath functionality at all.

THIS MUST BE FIXED, AND SOON TOO PLEASE!

i'll now post a link to this post on the various browser makers' support forums, and list those links in a comment to this post at stackoverflow.
creator: r7705

title: Choices in setting not checking. Can't tell what is on or off with 91.0!
content: None of the boxes in my setting are changing when I click on them. I have never had this problem before, and only since the 91.0 update today. I can't see what I've turned on or off, and it took me more than 20 minutes of experimenting to discover which choice I accidentally checked when my cat jumped onto my arm (the mouse button clicked before he stepped on the scroll wheel). I can't adjust anything if I can't see which choices I'm making, or which I don't think need to be changed. I did a fresh reinstall after, but having the same problem. The image was taken afterward. In it, I have tried to activate three choices. Can you tell me which ones? I can't tell, because none of the boxes have changed. And where did my separate tabs go? Having inactive tabs not separated, while the active tab is just floating there - literally, it is not just a floating sign acting as a tab - is seriously distracting. Is there a way to change this to, at the very least, make the inactive tabs separate again so the active one isn't such an independent eyesore?
